lines.text: [Melly has just swallowed a button from Pvt. Easy's jacket]
Oh, I do hope you're regular, Sir!
Regular? I've been regular for 18 years!
Oh, good. That means I can have it back tomorrow, then.
You'll have it back when I'm good and ready.
That's all right, Sir. No need to strain yourself!
[Sgt Tilly Willing sees Melly for the first time]
Two inches shorter, he could see right up my skirt!
[on arrival at the mixed battery]
Corporal!
That man, he's wearing lipstick!
Lipstick sir?
Yes.
Where?
On his face! Where do you think!
[welcoming Capt S. Melly]

[shouts]
Welcome to 1313 anti-aircraft battery Sir!
You up there! What's your name?
Ready, sir.
Ready? Ready... Willing... Able... This is ridiculous.
[Ready twitches]
What are you doing?

[shouts]
Twitching, Sir!
I can see that Sergeant Major, but why is he twitching?
It's me nerves, Sir!
Trying to twitch your ticket, eh? Well, it won't work, Bombardier. You're in the army for the duration. Twitch your way out of that!
[Bombardier Ready keeps twitching]
Twitch off!
[Leans closer]
Wasted on me, boy!
Good man, and what's your name?
Gunner Shorthouse.
[Melly reacts]
Gunner Shorthouse, Sir, that's my name!
[Melly moves along the line]
And what is your name, my man? Er... woman.
Jennifer Ffoukes Sharpe, Sir, the Sharpe with an E and two F's in the Ffoukes. How do you do?
[Pvt Ffoukes crushes Capt S. Melly's hand while shaking it]

[Leaning in]
She too is also a ball squeezer, Sir.
Do your shoelace up and look sharp about it, Sharpe.
[She does so. before grabbing Sgt Maj Bloomer's leg and biting it]

[Standing up]
Oh, Tiger! I think you wonderful. When are you going to savage me?
If only you was a man I would sort you out!

[Pointing to Pvt. Owen's foot]
Well, you seem to have put your foot in it!
Not so much my foot, Sir, more my big toe.
What's wrong with your big toe?
Sprained it, Sir, didn't I, when I fell out of bed.

[shouts]
Pushed out of bed, more like!

[Turns to Bloomer]
Pushed out of bed, Sgt Maj?

[in unison]
And the same to you!
Permission to carry on, Sir?
Please do.
But I couldn't bear it, darling, if you strained something before we'd even... you know.
I do not know!
Let me teach you.
[picks up an artillery shell]
I find these things awfully exciting, I don't know why.
Surely in the interest of efficiency, you shouldn't have someone with those
[points at Easy's breasts]
doing that.
[points at the equipment]
Do you know Sir, you are absolutely right,
Yes, well I do try and keep abreast of things.

[calling Gunner Hiscocks]
Hiscocks!
I beg your parden?
Gunner Hiscocks! Replace those...
[points to Easy's breasts]
... Her, will you?
[points to Easy]
Carry on, Sergeant.
Hardly went off with a bang, eh, Melly?
Shall we commence in the Mess, Sir?
We seem to be in it already.
I'll show them who's wearing the trousers around here.
Have you got it up?
I beg your pardon?
The shell, man, the shell.
Silly boy!
Quick march!
As a result, headquarters have at last agreed to send us that most desirable piece of equipment to have handy at time of war... namely a gun.
I beg your pardon, Sir, but I has found you gets more out of the shower if they're's allowed to wake up sort of gradual like.
Well from now on, they're going to wake up sort of sudden like.
Got yourself in a bit of a hole there, Melly?
It's the real thing, Sergeant Major?
[hysterical laughter]
What are you laughing at?
Well, I'm happy Sir.
Happy? What, here?
What am I supposed to do with this? Eat it or rub it in?
You can bounce it off the ceiling for all I care.
[Capt. Melly gets a rubbish bin stuck on his backside]
Permission to un-numb bum, Sir?

[shouts]
Get on with it!
[Bloomer slaps Melly's bum and Melly yells with pain]
Cruel to be kind, Sir. Cruel to be kind.
[Major Butcher is called in to deal with some friction burns to Capt. S. Melly's bottom]
That's quite a nasty friction burn you have there. What you been doing, eh? Arsing about?
Frilly curtains? Basket of flowers? Brasiers?
Pardon, Sir?
Knickers!
Same to you, Sir!
This is one of these new mixed batteries.
So, that's what the Brigadier meant when he said this battery was an experiment.
Experiment, Sir. One does not need to experiment. They get that right of way, and all the time.
Ah yes, Sir. They gives me a headache too.
It's not a headache. It's the stomach. There's a button in it.
What you may now call a belly button, Sir.
[laughs]
Oh, shut up!
With respect, sir. 20 years I've been a Sergeant Major. Nobody told me to shut up before. I is the person what tells people to shut up, sir. It's one of the most important parts of my...
Shut up!
Up!
I could've sworn someone said 'bang'!
Oh, Leonard. Ooh, what a lovely idea.
What the blue blank blazes is that?
It's a gun, Sir.
But it's made of wood.
It's not a real gun yet, Sir.
A gun emplacement without a real gun?
With all respect, Sir. Remember there's a war on. Real guns is hard to come by.
Now, grit your teeth and we will have it off in a minute.
Are you a ventriloquist?
Oh no. Church of England.
A drop of calamine will soon get to the bottom of this.
Surely you don't mean a bit of the other?
There's that or the other, Sir. No matter what you call it, they has had it all, all the time. Been in and out of each others quarters like fiddler's elbows.
Alice, I don't think I can hold this pose much longer. I'll get a cramp.
All ATS personnel. I'm going to make men of you. As from this moment, skirts will not be worn. Skirts will not be worn.
Well, that'll be a bit drafty.
How you feeling, son?
It's just as though those explosions have reverberated all through my body.
Well, just so long as your helmets not damaged.
I'm going to make a couple of points here. Sergeant Major, when I said "that's all", I didn't mean "that's all", I meant "that's all", that's all.
That sounds like a lot of all's, Sir.

[about their dogs]
Yours may be bigger than mine, Sir. But I've been told mines got more bite.
Are you coming down my tunnel, or am I coming up yours?
[Pvt. Ffoukes Sharpe has rammed a round into the gun]
Get that thing out of there!

[Whispering]
She rammed it up, it can stay up!
In that case, gun loaded, Sir!
[Melly has stormed out after ordering the men to polish the floor of the hut]
I know what he wants!
What does he want?
He wants us to polish the floor, Sarge!
He's not going to get away with it - making us sweat like that!
What do you mean - *us*?
All right - He's not going to get away with making *you* sweat like this.
But he *is* getting away with it!

[Indicating the bloomers on the flagpole]
Whose flag is that supposed to be? Knicker-ragua?

[Melly enters the office, walks up to the desk, and salutes]
Captain Melly.

[Looking up from the whiskey bottle]
No, you must have come to the wrong place - my name's Bull!
No, I'm Melly - S. Melly!
Pity.
[holds up the bottle]
Have a drink!

[Bull has kissed Melly on the cheek]
He actually kissed me!

[the anti-aircraft battery experiences its first real air raid]
Move yourselves! Move yourselves! Come on, come on! Sixpence for every one you shoot down, two bob if it is a German!
[scene that was censored by British Board of Film Classification for the use of the word Focke]
Aircraft recognition. These is your new pin-ups. I bet none of you can tell the difference between a couple of Heinkels and a pair of Bristols.
No, but I can recognise a Focke when I see one.
